sentence.text: The condition was initially termed actin filament bundle assembly syndrome (macrocephaly, alopecia, cutis laxa, and scoliosis), based on the clinical features of the first identified family; however, with the expansion of the clinical phenotype in additional families, it was subsequently coined small GTPase mediated signal transduction syndrome.
Patients with small GTPase mediated signal transduction syndrome present phenotypic overlap with other conditions, including EDS (especially the dermatosparaxis and kyphoscoliosis subtypes).

Besides the hallmark features, this patient also presents problems not previously associated with small GTPase mediated signal transduction syndrome, including cervical vertebral fusion, mild hearing loss, and colonic fibrosis.
